March 11, 1957
Mr, ?loycfe Brooker
Department of Audio-Visual Instruction
National Education Association
1201 Sixteenth Street, N, W.
Washington 6, D, C,
Dear Flqydes
May I congratulate you on your excellent recent editorial (Educational
Confusion)? One of the best I’ve heard or seen, old boy. We’re certainly with
you.
Congratulations also on what sounds like a fine Convention. Our travel
budget no longer permits our "attending" conventions, unless we’re earmarked to
play a role commensurate with travel costs. You’ve all heard from me in past
years often enough so I’m glad to see new blood being involved, and I was
pretty "snowed" all month, with Hill on vacation and others away from the office.
Sincerely,
HJS/dfc
Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director
